column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#Text=Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search.
#Text=SWE Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers.
#Text=You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs.
#Text=As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to... product strategy and help develop your team.

#Text=SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day.
#Text=Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.
#Text=Google Cloud accelerates organizations� ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise.
#Text=We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google�s cutting-edge technology � all on the cleanest cloud in the industry.
#Text=Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
#Text=The US base salary range for this full-time position is $174,000-$276,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
#Text=Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location.
#Text=The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations.
#Text=Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.
#Text=Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.
#Text=Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits.
#Text=Learn more about benefits at Google\r
#Text=You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs\r
